sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews tonight. I'm Omzad. In these, the headlines this hour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Over 300 people evacuated from the besieged city of Mariupol as Moscow announces plans to open humanitarian corridors for three days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But Ukraine says shelling continues at the Avostal plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06

sentences.sentence: Here in the Cube, we look at a fake viral video that falsely claims Poland will send troops into Ukraine.

sentences.sentence: Good evening. President Volodymyr Zelensky confirmed that over 300 people had been evacuated from Ukraine to besiege port city of Mariupol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In a video address, Zelensky praised the successful rescue operation which transported civilians from the front line to the Ukrainian-controlled city of Zaporizhia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Efforts are ongoing in the Azovstal steel plant, the last Ukrainian stronghold in Mariupol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Moscow had announced plans for a three-day ceasefire in the plant to allow trapped civilians to flee.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: However, Ukrainian forces have accused Russia of violating the truce amid reports of sustained shelling in the Avostol plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: One commander of Ukraine's Azov Regiment said Russian troops were continuing their assault on the area in a deliberate attempt to disrupt evacuations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: President Zelensky said that children and wounded soldiers are stuck in the steelworks and in need of treatment before calling on the world community to offer help.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: As more evacuees arrive to the relative safety of Zafarizhia, some have been able to describe what life was like under constant fear of Russian attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Okay, well, over 6 billion euros in aid has been pledged to war-torn Ukraine following

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: an international donors conference in Warsaw.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Co-hosted by Poland and Sweden, the event brought together European dignitaries, international organisations and business leaders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Polish Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki said it was imperative for the free world to unite when Russia brings death.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's President Zelenski addressed those in attendance, saying the funds were vital for his country's economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's armed forces and heroic defenders are fighting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The victory depends not only on what is going on on the battlefield, but also on what is going on in the economy, on the humanitarian support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: the economy, on the humanitarian support. Well, for more on the pledges made at the Ukraine donor conference, our correspondent

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Efi Kutsakostu joins us now from Warsaw.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So Efi, we've seen that 6 billion euros has been pledged to Ukraine at this donor conference.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Will it be enough, though, to rebuild the country that's really been decimated by this war?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The answer of course is simply not. It's not enough of course to reconstruct the whole country after they were but of course it's a huge amount in order to support Ukraine in several fronts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: So, now coming back to the three pillars, one is of course humanitarian aid, the second one, which is very important, is the liquidity, because Ukraine needs this money in order to keep the state running even now, during the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: So we would say that this was a very important event, which is very close to the 9th of May, Europe's Day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

And this is up to the courage of the Ukrainian people who are now fighting in the country next to Poland back to you okay thank you for updating us there on the donor conference and of course the latest EU steps in the sanctioned package thanks so much welcome back to the program now misleading video has falsely claimed

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: that Poland is preparing to send soldiers into Ukraine to confront Russian troops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Matthew in the Cube has been taking a look at this latest example of online misinformation. Matthew?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Ever since Russia invaded Ukraine on February the 24th, both sides have on social media spread propaganda and false claims.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: This is a video that has gone viral in recent days, predominantly shared by pro-Russian accounts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: It claims, falsely, that Poland is preparing to send troops across the border into Ukraine to confront Russia, after a military general allegedly put the army on high alert. You can see that the logo of BBC News has been included in this video.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: But the footage is fake.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: There is no online record of the BBC producing any kind of publication.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: And senior disinformation journalists at the company have stated online that the video is fake.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The logo of BBC News therefore appears to have been artificially added in production. But what's more, there is no evidence that Poland is preparing to send troops into Ukrainian territory. We know that the country has approved military aid to its neighbour, but there is no evidence that it is planning to involve ground forces. On Twitter, the General Command of the Armed Forces dismissed a document that appeared in that fake video. They said that any such letter authorising the movement of troops into Ukraine is counterfeit and fake. It's not the first time we've seen the logo of a Western news organisation being used to spread false information about the war in Ukraine. But Maryam, government officials in Warsaw say that this is an example that Russia or even pro-Russian accounts are also carrying out a coordinated information operation against Poland as well. Okay Matthew, thank you for unbunking the latest misinformation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Thank you so much. Now the World Health Organization has estimated that as many as 15

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: million people were killed by coronavirus or as a result of overwhelmed health systems during the COVID-19 pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The figure is more than double the official death toll of 6 million with fatalities mainly coming from Europe, the Americas and Southeast Asia. The head of the UN agency has described the figure as sobering and believes it should persuade countries to invest in their health systems to combat future outbreaks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Voters across the UK are going to the polls on Thursday in local elections, which could prove significant in Northern Ireland and England. The results could have major implications of Prime Minister Boris Johnson as his Conservative Party is still reeling over the Partygate scandal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, in Belfast, polls suggest that Irish nationalist party Sinn Féin could claim a historic win as tensions over the Brexit protocol appear to have divided the unionist vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: European food safety standards have come under the spotlight in recent weeks following a

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: number of member states recalling food products over fears of contamination.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The latest complaint has been filed here in France against the Nestlé-owned Italian food giant, Brutoni, as Christopher Pitchers reports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: For the second time in a matter of weeks, food company Buitoni is once again in the grip of a food scandal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: A new complaint has been filed in France for E. coli poisoning in a range of pizzas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The two cases are in addition to the 150 reports of salmonella contamination recently revealed in nine member states, this time involving Kinder chocolate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Both instances reveal serious flaws in the European food safety system, which is considered one of the safest in the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: For consumer associations, it's not so much the European system that's at fault, but the EU country's lack of means and the manufacturers' lack of will.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We published a report three years ago which highlighted a worrying reduction in the resources allocated to these official controls, both in terms of budget and staffing levels in the health services.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And so this can eventually lead to this type of scandal because if manufacturers are simply left to their own devices, if we rely entirely on these self-controls that they carry out, then we risk missing certain manufacturing breaches.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In less than two years, the number of inspection staff has fallen by 7% in Spain, 10% in Belgium and 30% in France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The European Parliament has been calling for stronger legislation for many years now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: For some, though, it's inconsistent to leave it to companies to control their own products. This ambiguity just weakens the European system. No. No, today it's fine to say that we produce the best food in the world, which is true, but when I say no, I'm perhaps being a little harsh in saying that, but I think that it's also deliberate because I think that we need to make progress in this area we need to improve the legislation and there's still room for progress so we cannot be confident we're 80% but we still need to make up that 20% when contacted by Euronews the European food industry lobby food drink Europe said it did not wish to comment specifically on the two cases.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It says they are a matter for the businesses concerned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It adds, however, that food safety is a priority for the organisation's members and that it will continue to work with the European Commission, food chain partners and other stakeholders to ensure the highest standards of safety.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Chrystia Pitch is Euronews, Brussels. The UK Home Office has confirmed that former tennis star Boris Becker could be considered

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: for deportation. Last week, the three-time Wimbledon champion was jailed for two and a half years for hiding millions of euros worth of assets following his 2017 bankruptcy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Under UK law, any foreign national who has been convicted of a crime and given a jail sentence can be considered for deportation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Experts say that Becker may have to represent himself if he wishes to remain in the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Welcome back to Euronews tonight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Welcome back to Euronews tonight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Now the city of Cordova in southern Spain has thrown its patios open to the public as part of an annual festival. The event that's been going on since 1921 allows the public to catch a glimpse of the beautiful flower-filled open spaces as Mark Armstrong explains.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: open spaces as Mark Armstrong explains. In the southern Spanish community of Andalusia, the annual festival of patios is underway in Cordoba.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Due to the hot, dry climate in the region, the city's inhabitants, Romans and later Arabs, adapted house design to their needs, typically building their homes around an inner patio.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They often included a fountain in the middle and a well to collect rainwater. As well as improving airflow and providing shade, the courtyards fostered an atmosphere of tranquility and peace. Every year, under a UNESCO-listed tradition, a selection of the iconic courtyards is open to the public, giving them an opportunity to enjoy these beautiful spaces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: When you enter a courtyard, all your senses are awakened.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: First of all, the sight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: From the moment you enter through the door, at the end of the hallway, you see an intense light.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And when you acclimatize, you see an infinity of colors and shades of green.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There's always the scent of plants and flowers, and we also have the sound, the singing of the birds, a canary in the cage, and the trickle of the fountain that can't be left out of the patios of Córdoba." Since 1921, the town hall in Córdoba has organized an annual competition of courtyards and crosses in the first week of May.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Owners decorate their houses with many flowers planted in beds and pots, which either hang from walls or are placed on paving specific to Cordoba.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: For the residents of this historic city, to win the award is regarded as a great honour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And that's it from myself and the team, but we leave you with a no comment from Washington, D.C., where President Joe Biden received Olympians and Paralympians at a special ceremony at the White House.
